Improve this resume bullet:
""We are in search of an innovative and seasoned AI Specialist to spearhead the development of a personalized and dynamic technical support chat system driven by Large Language Models (LLMs). The ideal candidate will possess a robust background in artificial intelligence, particularly in LLMs like GPT-3, GPT-4, or similar cutting-edge technologies. This pivotal role entails conceptualizing, executing, and managing a system that learns from user interactions to deliver real-time, accurate, and educational support experiences. Working closely with our product development and customer support teams, the successful candidate will ensure that the chat system enhances our user experience and aligns seamlessly with our technical support objectives.Key Responsibilities:1. Design and deploy a bespoke and interactive technical support chat system leveraging LLMs.2. Integrate the chat system with existing platforms and databases to retrieve pertinent information and offer contextually-aware assistance.3. Train the model on domain-specific data to ensure precision and relevance in responses.4. Establish a feedback mechanism where the chat system assimilates insights from user interactions, fostering continuous enhancement of its performance.5. Collaborate with the technical support team to pinpoint prevalent issues and embed solutions into the chat system.6. Monitor and assess the system's efficacy, implementing refinements as needed to elevate response accuracy and user satisfaction.Budget: $20Posted On: February 16, 2024 16:03 UTCCategory: Machine LearningSkills:Vertex AI, Chatbot, ChatGPT, ChatGPT API Integration, Django, Technical SupportSkills: Vertex AI, Chatbot, ChatGPT, ChatGPT API Integration, Django, Technical SupportCountry: United States""

Improve this resume bullet:
""Hello everybody. I’m looking for a long cooperation (we can negotiate about the price) with anyone who can do drafting for joiners (of a kitchen or living room furniture, bed etc.) and Idealy also for someone who can do 3D models of for example kitchen or a living room... If you can do both than that’s the best option. I would sent you all the measurements and the specifications of what I would want it to look like. And you would create the 3D model and drafting for it.The hardest thing I would need is a kitchen.In Files I sent you a picture of a kitchen. That is just an example to find out if you could do draftings for something like that. I don’t need you to do it for that picture a simple answer yes I can, will be plenty. Also I sent you a presentation of what I mean by draftings. All measurements must be in CM. If you can do what I’m asking for than text me and pretty soon I’ll have a plenty of work for you. Improve this resume bullet:
""**Objective:**The objective of this work is to calculate the costs associated with the installation of framing, drywall installation, tape finishing, painting, and insulation in a residential construction project. The estimator will use information from the provided drawings, consult our material price lists, and consider an hourly rate not exceeding $35.**Responsibilities:**1. **Drawing Review:**- Thoroughly examine all provided drawings to identify areas related to the project scope.- Ensure a complete understanding of specifications and requirements associated with each task.2. **Quantity Calculation:**- Estimate the quantities required for framing, drywall installation, tape finishing, painting, and insulation based on the provided drawings and dimensions.3. **Material Price List Consultation:**- Utilize our internal material price lists to obtain unit costs associated with each task.- Ensure to consider any specific items or materials mentioned in the drawings.4. **Cost Calculation:**- Calculate the total costs for each project component by multiplying the estimated quantities by the corresponding unit costs.5. **Hourly Rate:**- Consider a maximum hourly rate of $35 for any labor involved in the project.- Ensure proper allocation of time for each task based on complexity and labor requirements.6. **Contingencies and Profit Margin:**- Include a contingency margin for possible cost variations or unforeseen circumstances during project execution.- Add an appropriate profit margin to ensure the financial viability of the project.**Deliverables:**- Detailed estimate report.- Supporting documentation, including calculated quantities, unit material costs, and any assumptions made during the estimation process.Budget: $200Posted On: February 16, 2024 16:02 UTCCategory: Civil EngineeringSkills:Construction Estimating, Civil EngineeringSkills: Construction Estimating, Civil EngineeringCountry: Ireland""

Improve this resume bullet:
""IntroductionAuthor attribution is the task of identifying the author of a given text based on the writing style. In this study, you will evaluate the quality of explanations generated by machine learning models that justify their decision on specific tasks of author attribution. The task consists of two phases: Phase 1 and Phase 2. In the following, we will explain each.Note: Because a portion of the data comes from social media posts, it is possible that you come across potentially distressing content or ideas. However, this content might not be extreme and can be found in public social media. By accepting to perform this task, you agree to participate in this study; you have the right to stop annotating at any time.In both phases, you will solve 70 tasks, each taking between 15 and 20 minutes.Phase 1:This phase consists of solving two types of tasks that we explain below (Task 1 and Task 2). You will be solving 50 tasks in total; each task is expected to take a maximum of 20 minutes to complete.Task 1:Task context. Law enforcement has identified a forum post we call a Query document (Q document). An investigation has resolved the origin of the post to a particular device such that it must have been written by one of the four potential authors: A, B, C, or D. Law enforcement need to know if there is evidence to support identifying one of the suspects for further investigation.Task description. Your task is to read the Query document as well as the posts from each author and determine which of the candidate authors is likely to have written the Query documents. In some of these tasks, you will also be given extra explanations of the linguistic, stylistic, and/or semantic features of the Query document, as well as posts from each author.Then, only if this information is given, you will have to answer a set of questions on the quality of explanations.Task 2:Task context. Same as Task 1 contextTask description. This time, you will be presented with an AI agent’s prediction of the Query document's author and the machine-generated explanation that justifies this prediction. Your task is to judge different aspects of the explanation you just saw with respect to the prediction.Annotation PlatformOn the annotation platform, click on the “Author Attribution Explanation” project. You will then be prompted with a summary of the instructions, and then you can start the evaluation. The total 50 tasks are composed of 10 sets of 5 tasks each, sequentially presented to you. Each set consists of the same Query and Author documents. The first task in the set consists of you solving the Type 1 task without any provided explanations. The second and third tasks in the set consist of you solving the Type 1 task but with explanations provided by two systems (describing the documents’ writing style and the overall similarity). The fourth and fifth tasks are of Type 2, where we additionally show the AI agent prediction by the two systems, and you have to answer questions regarding the prediction.Noe: More details on this Phase can be found in the Phase 1 Study Instruction and Info Sheet in the attachments.Phase 2:For each task, you will be presented with a query document and four candidate documents, along with the AI’s prediction of the author of the query document with explanations of the decision. Then, you will reason about the AI’s prediction on a follow-up document. You are to guess what the AI would predict. In total, you will solve 20 tasks.Note that your task is NOT to annotate the correct answers to the follow-up questions but rather guess the Robot's answers based on its explanation and answer in the starter text.Budget: $500Posted On: February 13, 2024 18:12 UTCCategory: Experimentation & TestingSkills:Content Writing, Linguistics, Writing, Natural Language ProcessingSkills: Content Writing, Linguistics, Writing, Natural Language ProcessingLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""

Improve this resume bullet:
""IntroductionWe have developed an AI News Analysis web app that leverages Python for its development. The application integrates Bing News and Search API, as well as the OpenAI API, to enhance user input queries. The primary objective of this web application is to provide users with immediate answers to their queries through news and web search. The application consists of three main components, all of which utilize both the OpenAI and Bing APIs.Current challenges:Our current challenge is that the application code is not optimized, contains many unused libraries,and the code not the best which results in a larger Docker image. This issue hinders our ability to deploy our API on AWS Lambda functions.ObjectiveThe main goal is to rewrite the application code from scratch for optimization & enhancement, develop an API for the existing functions using FastAPI, and deploy the optimized application on AWS Lambda functions. This will ensure that the application is efficient, scalable, and meets the deployment requirements of AWS Lambda.Scope of Work1. Code Analysis• Objective: Study and understand the current codebase to extract the necessary logic and functionalities.• Tasks:• Review the existing web app's codebase.• Identify key functionalities, algorithms, and logic used in the application.• Document the core components and their interactions.2. Code Rewrite• Objective: Rewrite the application code from scratch using the documented logic and functionalities as a reference, ensuring optimization and efficiency.• Tasks:• Develop a clean, optimized codebase using Python, focusing on minimizing dependencies and removing unused libraries.• Ensure the new codebase adheres to best practices for scalability, maintainability, and performance.• Incorporate Bing News and Search API and OpenAI API integrations as per the existing logic.3. FastAPI Development• Objective: Develop a FastAPI-based API for all the application functions to facilitate easy integration and scalability.• Tasks:• Design and implement API endpoints for each functionality of the web app.• Ensure comprehensive API documentation for ease of use and integration.• Implement authentication and authorization mechanisms to secure API access.4. Deployment on AWS Lambda• Objective: Deploy the optimized application on AWS Lambda functions, ensuring that the deployment is efficient and the application is scalable.• Tasks:• Containerize the FastAPI application using Docker, ensuring the Docker image is optimized for size and performance.• Set up the AWS Lambda environment and configure it to host the Docker container.• Implement CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment of the application.Deliverables• A fully rewritten and optimized codebase for the AI News Analysis web app.• A fully functional FastAPI API for the web app's functionalities.• Documentation covering the API endpoints, usage, and integration guide.• A deployed and functional version of the application on AWS Lambda.Project TimelineThe project is expected to be completed within TWO WEEKS, from the commencement date. A detailed timeline will be provided upon project initiation, outlining key milestones and deadlines.ConclusionThis project aims to significantly improve the performance, scalability, and deployment capabilities of the AI News Analysis web app. By rewriting the application code from scratch, developing a FastAPI API, and deploying the application on AWS Lambda, we aim to provide a robust solution that meets the immediate and future needs of our users.Budget: $350Posted On: February 18, 2024 14:54 UTCCategory: Generative AI ModelingSkills:LLM Prompt Engineering, Generative AI, Retrieval Augmented Generation, Python, Software Development, API, Database, Software Architecture & Design, Web DevelopmentSkills: LLM Prompt Engineering, Generative AI, Retrieval Augmented Generation, Python, Software Development, API, Database, Software Architecture & Design, Web DevelopmentCountry: United States""
